subject: Spell Checkers and Posting with Quickscript
msgSnippet: Thanks to Paige and Jon over the last couple days for their feedback.  It is nice to be read and considered. Spell Checkers  ************************** Jon
messageBody:
Thanks to Paige and Jon over the last couple days for their
feedback. It is nice to be read and considered.

Spell Checkers **************************

Jon mentioned that spell checkers do not work for quickscript. True
enough, unless we spend the time to build a dictionary to check our
spellings... which could be done but is a long term project.

Of more interest to me is the nasty habit of MS Word's auto correct
features. It is nice when it corrects my lack of a capital letter in
english at the beginning a sentence or auto corrects my usual
misspellings. But I always need to remember to turn that little
feature off when I am writing in Shavian or Quickscript!

I have occasionally gone back to look at what I had written only to
find that a bunch of words made no sense when I read them... it was
the auto correct at fault. It's bad enough that I automatically want
to make the first letter of every sentence start with a capital...
which is the wrong thing to do in these scripts.

Posting with Quickscript ***************

I need a little help here. It is very difficult for me to post in
the scripts we are working with.

I have discovered that I *can* post with my email program (The Yahoo
internet email) and include script if I write the whole post in html
as a text file and preview the html before I send it. Of course, I
have to remember to include all the html for paragraph breaks and
all... What a pain! It is also ugly to be typing and looking at the
roman characters and only later get to see the quickscript.

Worse, I have not found a way to include any html in a response I
write when I am working directly out of the group page as a post.
(like now) What is the clue to get the system to allow me to post
html... Even better, how can I actually see the quickscript I would
like to be writing as I type it and then paste it into the post
window??? (Or even post as quickscript font???)

The "Shavian" Ironboard maintained by Hugh is a great little
invention where all the entries are automatically written in
Lionspaw. Is there a way to do anything similar here???

I have not used Outlook for this problem, as I have tried to keep off
outlook outside my work environment. (virus attacks) Will posting
work better if I break down and use outlook? Is that the secret to a
pretty little post like Jon sent me yesterday? His ability to easily
mix the roman english and the quickscript font was very nice. I
would like to be able to do the same.

/rik
